import React from 'react' import fridge1 from '../../Images/appliances/whirlpool-refrigerator.png' import './Appliance.css' const RefrigeratorRepair = () => { return

Refrigerator and Freezer repair

Whether it's routine maintenance or emergency repairs, Major Appliance Repair is here to restore your refrigerator's functionality with expertise and care. Experience the peace of mind that comes with knowing your appliance is in capable hands.

The average lifespan of a refrigerator typically ranges from 10 to 15 years, with many factors influencing this duration. The type of refrigerator, usage patterns, maintenance, model, and brand can all affect how long a fridge lasts. Some of the more advanced or high-end models may have a longer lifespan, potentially extending up to 20 years with proper care and maintenance. Regular maintenance, such as cleaning the condenser coils, ensuring the door seals are intact, and keeping the fridge adequately filled, can help extend its lifespan. On the other hand, frequent overloading, poor ventilation, and irregular cleaning can shorten a refrigerator's life. It's also worth noting that the lifespan of refrigerators has evolved over time with advancements in technology and changes in manufacturing practices. Modern refrigerators may have different lifespans compared to older models due to these advancements and changes in materials used.

What you can do before calling for service

Check Power Supply

Inspect the Thermostat

Listen for Unusual Noises

Check the Condenser Coils

Examine the Door Seals

Inspect the Evaporator Fan

Check the Compressor

Look at the Defrost System

Assess the Water Connection

Consult the User Manual

}; export default RefrigeratorRepair;
